brief_description: To use system biology approaches to compare differences in immune responses to vaccine
brief_title: Immune Responses to Seasonal TIV 2010-2011 Influenza Vaccination in Humans (see companion study SDY396,SDY564)
description: High-frequency sampling combined with systems biology analysis of human peripheral blood cells following influenza vaccination was used to investigate T cell and B cell responses. Functional principal component analysis was used to examine time varying B cell vaccine response highlighting a single subject-specific mathematical pattern explaining ninety percent of the transcriptome variation. In addtition, daily sampling and monitoring of the proliferation marker Ki-67, revealed influenza-specific CD4 T cells do respond to vaccination.
endpoints: Blood samples prior to vaccination and daily sampling  post vaccination up to 10 days and day 21
hypothesis: To understand and describe the mulitdimensional immune response to vaccination
objectives: Develop detailed, multi-level, multi-scale high dimensional mathematical models of  the immune response to seasonal influenza vaccination
official_title: Immune Responses to Seasonal TIV 2010-2011 Influenza Vaccination in Humans (see companion study SDY396,SDY564)
